alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:51PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow will impact portions of Norton, northern Decatur and eastern Red Willow Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 850 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow along a line extending from 3 miles north of Indianola to 3 miles west of Lebanon to 4 miles north of Oberlin. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lebanon around 855 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Norcatur. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
